title: 115_hr566
content: The Act may be cited as the "Terror-Free Skies Act". The Congress acknowledges that Iran is the world's foremost state sponsor of terrorism, providing support to various terrorist organizations and rogue regimes through its Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) and national air carrier, Iran Air. Iran Air, owned by the Iranian government, was designated by the U.S. Treasury for supporting the IRGC by shipping military equipment and transporting rockets to Syria. Despite being delisted in 2016, Iran Air continues unscheduled flights on weapons supply routes between Iran and Syria. Iran Air, owned by the Iranian government, was designated by the U.S. Treasury for supporting the IRGC by shipping military equipment and transporting rockets to Syria. Despite being removed from the Specially Designated National (SDN) list in 2016, the U.S. Department of the Treasury has not confirmed that Iran Air has ceased its illicit activities. The U.S. retains the ability to designate individuals or entities engaging in sanctionable activities related to Iran's support for terrorism, human rights abuses, ballistic missile program, and destabilizing activities in the region. Iran Air, previously designated as a Specially Designated National (SDN) in 2016, has continued supporting the IRGC, MODAFL, Hezbollah, and the Bashar al-Assad regime. The government of Iran is being investigated for using commercial aircraft and related services for illicit military or other activities. The President must submit a report every 180 days on Iran's use of commercial aircraft for illicit military activities to specific committees in Congress. The Government of Iran has used commercial aircraft, including Iran Air, to transport illicit military cargo. The commercial aviation sector of Iran has supported various military entities and foreign governments have facilitated these activities. If the President determines that Iran Air or any other Iranian commercial airliner has used commercial aircraft for illicit military purposes after January 16, 2016, they will be designated as a specially designated national and blocked person within 90 days. SEC. 4. SUNSET. This Act will end 30 days after the President certifies to Congress that Iran has stopped supporting international terrorism.
